vehicles.description: A stationary vehicle parked in the right lane, with its hazard lights flashing, is located directly in the path of our car.
vehicles.explanation: The presence of parked vehicles requires the self-driving car to change its route to avoid collisions.

traffic cones.description: Reflective traffic cones arranged diagonally across a lane indicate that the road is tapering down to a single lane.
traffic cones.explanation: These cones are directing traffic into a single-lane pattern, requiring vehicles to merge when necessary and to drive with caution.

barriers.description: There is an obstacle with reflective elements on the right side of the road.
barriers.explanation: The obstacle indicates that roadwork or area closure is underway, signaling that vehicles should stay within their lane and be alert to potential hazards.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image, there is a stationary vehicle parked in the right lane, directly in the path of our car, with its hazard lights flashing. This situation requires the self-driving car to alter its course to avoid a collision. Additionally, reflective traffic cones are arranged diagonally across a lane, indicating that the road is narrowing to a single lane. This setup directs traffic to merge when necessary and to proceed with caution. Furthermore, there is an obstacle with reflective elements on the right side of the road, suggesting that there is roadwork or an area closure, and vehicles should remain in their lane and be vigilant for potential hazards. There are no vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic lights, or other objects present in the image that affect the driving behavior of the autonomous vehicle.

driving_suggestion: Your vehicle should slow down and prepare to change lanes to the left, to safely navigate around the stopped vehicle and traffic cones. Be cautious when merging lanes at night, as visibility may be reduced, and pay attention to any possible additional obstacles or road users that may not be easily visible. Maintain alertness to your surroundings, and look out for any road signs or additional information that may assist in safely passing through the area.

1.description and explanation: This is a traffic cone, typically used to signal temporary changes in traffic patterns or to mark hazards. Its reflective surface enhances visibility, particularly at night or in low-light conditions. As a result, the driver of the ego car should exercise caution and potentially reduce speed, as the traffic cone might indicate roadwork, an accident, or another type of obstruction ahead.

2.description and explanation: A traffic cone, typically a cone-shaped marker that is placed on roads or footpaths to temporarily redirect traffic in a safe manner. It often has a white and orange reflective surface for high visibility. In this scenario, it is used to indicate some form of road work, obstruction, or to demarcate a specific lane that the ego car should not enter. The presence of this cone will require the driver of the ego car to be alert and possibly shift lanes if the cone is blocking the current lane of travel, or to slow down to pass safely.
